alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 10:44PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM PST. * IMPACTS...There will be widespread pondingof water on area roadways and local flooding of low lying areas and intersections. Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Mud and rockslides are possible on canyon roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Carpinteria, Cambria, Solvang, Vandenberg Air Force Base, Orcutt, Los Alamos and Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain and near burn scars.
